texts.definition: Game elements fixed in particular locations in Game Worlds that allow actions or events not possible elsewhere.
markups: <style="Definition">Game elements fixed in particular locations in Game Worlds that allow actions or events not possible elsewhere.</style>

While players typically have access to a certain set of actions besides moving while exploring game worlds, the items that can be found within the worlds can provide additional actions. <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> are items that do this but cannot be moved, thereby forcing players to be at specific positions in order to be able to use these actions.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-person shooters</link></style>, such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Doom%20series">Doom</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake series</link></style>, often have doors that have to be opened through activating <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style>. Abstract <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> can be found in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Return%20to%20Castle%20Wolfenstein:%20Enemy%20Territory">Return to Castle Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory</link></style> as players can construct bridges, command centers, and towers in certain places.

Mounted weapons found in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Return%20to%20Castle%20Wolfenstein:%20Enemy%20Territory">Return to Castle Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style>, and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style> are all examples of <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> that provide players with increased firepower at specific locations. The cannons in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Super%20Mario%2064">Super Mario 64</link></style> are also <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style>, but in this case have the more peaceful ability to allow Mario reach areas otherwise inaccessible by shooting himself from them.

Two main types of <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> exist: <style="Link"><link="switches">Switches</link></style> that set events in motion when activated and <style="Link"><link="installations">Installations</link></style> that provide players with <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>. Examples of effects started by <style="Link"><link="switches">Switches</link></style> include opening <style="Link"><link="conditional-passageways">Conditional Passageways</link></style>, finishing <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style>, or initiating <style="Link"><link="quick-travel">Quick Travel</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="switches">Switches</link></style> may also affect <style="Link"><link="environmental-effects">Environmental Effects</link></style> if their geographical spread are fixed, otherwise affecting them are more probably abilities and affected through <style="Link"><link="installations">Installations</link></style>. Both types of <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> can affect <style="Link"><link="moveable-tiles">Moveable Tiles</link></style>, but <style="Link"><link="switches">Switches</link></style> are of limited usefulness to control their <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style> rather than just start and stop it.

<style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> do not have to be tangible game elements and those that are not represents a third type of <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style>. They can be areas where the <style="Link"><link="construction">Construction</link></style> or destruction of game elements are possible, and one examples of this are the boxes of construction material in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Return%20to%20Castle%20Wolfenstein:%20Enemy%20Territory">Return to Castle Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory</link></style> which can be assembled to specific game elements, such as bridges or bases.

Several options of available for all types of <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style>: which <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> can use them, are specific <style="Link"><link="skills">Skills</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style> are needed to use them, and are <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> are consumed by using them. Further, using them can require <style="Link"><link="extended-actions">Extended Actions</link></style> (e.g. requiring the constant activation of a player), and the effects they cause can be both <style="Link"><link="ultra-powerful-events">Ultra-Powerful Events</link></style> (for example when activating <style="Link"><link="moveable-tiles">Moveable Tiles</link></style>) and <style="Link"><link="irreversible-events">Irreversible Events</link></style>.

As <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> are often presented as large machines or systems, or the control panels for these, they can affect parts of a <style="Link"><link="game-boards">Game Board</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game World</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="levels">Level</link></style> out of the usual reach of <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> without breaking <style="Link"><link="thematic-consistency">Thematic Consistency</link></style>.

Some <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style>, especially <style="Link"><link="installations">Installations</link></style>, may switch players' interfaces to better help support the activities and actions they provide. This may be changing <style="Link"><link="hud-interfaces">HUD Interfaces</link></style> or switching from <style="Link"><link="first-person-views">First-Person Views</link></style> to <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style> or vice versa. Examples of both of these possibilities exist in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Half-Life%202">Half-Life 2</link></style> does the same, and has a magnetic crane which provides a different view point for players since the scale it works on is different from the normal one in the game.

Compared to <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style>, <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> (and especially <style="Link"><link="switches">Switches</link></style>) let game designers structure where and when players can perform actions which functionally for them are <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style>. This can be used to progress <style="Link"><link="predetermined-story-structures">Predetermined Story Structures</link></style> and when <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> are used in this way their effects are typically both <style="Link"><link="irreversible-events">Irreversible Events</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="ultra-powerful-events">Ultra-Powerful Events</link></style>. One example of this is that the activation of <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> can often be the completion of goals, <style="Link"><link="quests">Quests</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> gives players or <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> access to <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style>, quite often <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged Abilities</link></style>, when their <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> are near them. They are natural <style="Link"><link="strategic-locations">Strategic Locations</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> since having access to their <style="Link"><link="location-fixed-abilities">Location-Fixed Abilities</link></style> may require <style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style> and this can spawn goals of <style="Link"><link="gain-ownership">Gain Ownership</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> that are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Resource%20Generators">Resource Generators</link></style> provide a way to have <style="Link"><link="renewable-resources">Renewable Resources</link></style> in games and create <style="Link"><link="resource-locations">Resource Locations</link></style>.

While providing <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style> can make <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> give players <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style> and a greater <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>, both these patterns most clearly materialize when the <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> are used to make <style="Link"><link="quests">Quests</link></style> be completed.

As mentioned above, <style="CurrentLink">Controllers</style> can depending on their design modulate <style="Link"><link="alarms">Alarms</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="environmental-effects">Environmental Effects</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="conditional-passageways">Conditional Passageways</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="quick-travel">Quick Travel</link></style>.

<style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="construction">Construction</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="gain-ownership">Gain Ownership</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="irreversible-events">Irreversible Events</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="location-fixed-abilities">Location-Fixed Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="predetermined-story-structures">Predetermined Story Structures</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="strategic-locations">Strategic Locations</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="thematic-consistency">Thematic Consistency</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="ultra-powerful-events">Ultra-Powerful Events</link></style>
